textBeforeTable: DAY 1 Week 1 How to pick out the correct amount of weight for each exercise. Begin with a weight that is easy, the last 4-5 repetitions should be challenging. Complete the set even if it means to lower the weights in the middle of the set. Some exercises may not need weights at all, like push-ups, reverse and regular lunges and squats. Squats, reverse lunges and regular lunges add weights by holding them in your hands while doing the exercises. When doing your aerobics keep your heart rate between 60 and 80 percent of your maximum. Your maximum heart rate is determined by taking the number 220 – your age=maximum hear rate. Now multiply that number by .80 and .60. Example would be a 40 year old keeps their heart rate between 108 and 144 beats per minute. 12-week program-3 days a week. 3 day a week works out, 3 days of weights and a minimum of 3 days of aerobics. Lifting and aerobics can be done on the same day or opposite days. Aerobics can be anything from riding a bike, to walking, and using a  stairmaster etc…  Equipment needed: Swiss balls, 4 - 5 pound dumbbells, floor mat.
